intro: Hieracium euryanthelum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium euryanthelum is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it thrives in moist to dry soils.
